text: Sayadaw U Ottama ( ; also U Uttama (); 28 December 1879 â€“ 9 September 1939) was a Theravada Buddhist monk, author, and a leader of the Burmese independence movement during British colonial rule. The ethnic Rakhine (Arakanese) monk was imprisoned several times by the British colonial government for his anti-colonialist political activities. He is considered a national hero in modern Myanmar. == References == Category:Buddhist monks Category:Burmese activists Category:1879 births Category:1939 deaths
